thread.title: No TV or singing: sisters rule the roost in Donegal pub
thread.title_full: No TV or singing: sisters rule the roost in Donegal pub

author: Caitriona McBride
title: No TV or singing: sisters rule the roost in Donegal pub
text:
No TV or singing: sisters rule the roost in Donegal pub The Brennan sisters have lived above the Criterion Bar in Bundoran all their lives about 15 hours ago 
Nan Brennan, inside The Criterion Bar, Bundoran, Co. Donegal.Photograph: James Connolly 
Patricia Brennan and Nan Brennan, inside The Criterion Bar. Photograph: James Connolly 
Grandfather Clock at the top of the stairs. Photograph: James Connolly 
One of the upstairs sitting rooms. Photograph: James Connolly 
Patricia Brennan stands outside her bedroom. Photograph: James Connolly 
Patricia and Nan Brennan in the downstairs sitting room. Photograph: James Connolly 
Nan and Patricia Brennan outside their pub. Photograph: James Connolly Previous Image Previous Images More Images Walking into Brennan’s Criterion Bar in the seaside town of Bundoran , Co Donegal is like being taken by the hand into a piece of Irish history which has been preserved so remarkably well that you never want to the waltz to end. You may also be overcome with an urge to become best friends with the wonderful, unique sisters, Nan (80) and Patricia Brennan (78) who run it, have been reared there, and call it home.
